column4: Hi. Need help with regexp/sed. I'd like to "grep" a part of a filename ("video Tc0 L2 2ch 48 192 DELAY 0ms.mp2"). I'd like to catch the 0 in front of ms and after DELAY. It's always an number but might be positive or negative.
Thanks, Stargaze, will look into it now
tried to figure it out with the posted articel + some more tutorials, but havent get past ls | grep -e '/DELAY/,/ms/' which leaves me with a blank line :(
